instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with 20V but no signs of life
threads.message:
This 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board shows 20V on USB-C pulling 0.05A. No liquid damage. I have <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at 12.6V and the SLP and AWAKE voltages are present. It is missing all G3S rails and their <SIGNAL>G3S_EN</SIGNAL> signals, which come from the PMU <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>. 

What does <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> require to produce the <SIGNAL>G3S_EN</SIGNAL> signals?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with 20V but no signs of life
threads.message: Try DFU revive first; restore, if no important data to save.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with 20V but no signs of life
threads.message: The machine enters DFU mode but since all SSD power rails are 0V, the DFU Restore fails with the timeout error. I need to get my power rails restored first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with 20V but no signs of life
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on SSD power rails.
Many times, SSD and G3S voltages appear after complete DFU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with 20V but no signs of life
threads.message: The SSD power rails are all free of shorts. I'll try DFU Restore again with/with battery and with/without charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with 20V but no signs of life
threads.message: No luck. I've tried 6 times to Restore/Revive and I always get the "gave up waiting" error. SSD and G3S rails are still missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with 20V but no signs of life
threads.message: Check for short on any other big coil

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with 20V but no signs of life
threads.message: All big coils measure the same resistances to ground as on a good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with 20V but no signs of life
threads.message:
The battery is charging?
Keep it connected in DFU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with 20V but no signs of life
threads.message: Mystery solved! I just did a gentle reflow of the PMU (<CHIP>U7800</CHIP>), just in case it was the problem point. This restored the SSD and all other power rails and the DFU Restore went through. I can't say for certain why this worked but the machine is up and running now.
